title.rendered: Vaughan Handyman: 3 Benefits of Hardwood Floors in the Basement

content.rendered:
If you’re in the process of remodeling your basement, you should choose a flooring material that will elevate the space. Hardwood floors in your basement are the perfect option to give your space maximum flexibility and long-lasting beauty. Handyman Connection is a hardwood flooring Vaughan specialist, with installation services for residential and commercial customers.

The Steps of a Professional Hardwood Flooring Installation

Attempting to install hardwood floors in your basement yourself isn’t recommended. A better option is to allow the Vaughan flooring restoration and repair pros, the Handyman Connection, to take on this challenging project. Here is our process:

  • Level the concrete subfloor and smooth out any imperfections.
  • Put down a moisture barrier and nail down plywood on top of the concrete.
  • Nail hardwood boards using a flooring nailer or nail gun.
  • Install baseboard around the perimeter of the room for finishing.

Hardwood floors can go with any type of decor. Here are three other benefits of installing hardwood in your basement:

1. Ease of Maintaining Floors

The first advantage of having hardwood in your basement is easy maintenance. Some flooring materials require specific cleaning routines and maintenance over time by the homeowner. With hardwood, you don’t need to perform any type of maintenance routine. You also don’t need to apply any special treatments or solutions to your hardwood floors over the years.

A family basement can be a busy space, with lots of traffic and activity from kids, pets and other family members. When your floors get dirty, it’s a quick cleaning process. All you need to do is sweep up the dirt or vacuum floors and then quickly mop the wood to remove any grime.

2. Durability of Hardwood

The next reason you should invest in professional hardwood flooring for your basement is its strong durability. Many types of other flooring materials need to be replaced or repaired frequently. The carpet starts to look tired after about five years and needs to be replaced. Tile floors may begin to crack and lose their lustre after a few years as well.

Hardwood flooring is durable enough to last for decades in a space. If your basement doubles as a playroom, game room or family room space, hardwood has the strength to withstand lots of roughhousing kids and pets. It can also be durable against moisture that may be present in the basement space as long as it’s professionally installed.

3. Elegant Look and Feel

Finally, the third reason to choose hardwood floors for your basement is the look. Hardwood floors add a new level of sophistication to your basement space. They can match any type of decor or style. Additionally, you can get further customization by choosing the type of wood, the grain and the stain that works best with your style.

Having hardwood floors throughout your basement may also be a great way to add more resell value to your property. When it’s time to sell your home, future buyers may appreciate the care and consideration that went into your basement flooring choice and renovation.

Hardwood Flooring Vaughan Experts

To get the best-looking hardwood floors, you should choose to hire a professional experienced with basement floor installation, like Handyman Connection. There are unique challenges to installing hardwood in a basement, and the average homeowner may not be able to achieve a flawless look. When hardwood floors are installed well, they look beautiful and can last for decades.

If you’re still not sure which type of flooring would be best in your basement, reach out to Handyman Connection today to get more information about our flooring installation services. Let us help you choose the perfect floor for your basement space.
